summary: Elizabeth J Palmer was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). She is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list her name, position, and salary during that period. The documents suggest she was a staff member of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Elizabeth J Palmer's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee responsible for reinvestigating the JFK assassination. While the documents do not specify her exact role, her inclusion in payroll and certification reports indicates she was part of the staff involved in the committee's operations.
